verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, in the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: In the eleventh year, in the third month, in the first day of the month, LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: On the 1st day of the 3rd month, in the 11th year, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, and to his multitude; Whom art thou like in thy greatness?
verses.web: “Son of man, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt, and his multitude: ‘Whom are you like in your greatness?
verses.ct: "Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and all his people: 'Who can compare to you in greatness?

verses.kjv: Behold, the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with fair branches, and with a shadowing shroud, and of an high stature; and his top was among the thick boughs.
verses.web: Behold, the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with beautiful branches, and with a forest-like shade, of high stature; and its top was among the thick boughs.
verses.ct: Think of Assyria — it was like a cedar in Lebanon with beautiful branches casting deep shade, towering high with its crown reaching into the thick canopy above.

verses.kjv: The waters made him great, the deep set him up on high with her rivers running round about his plants, and sent out her little rivers unto all the trees of the field.
verses.web: The waters nourished it. The deep made it to grow. Its rivers ran all around its plantation; and it sent out its channels to all the trees of the field.
verses.ct: Underground springs nourished it, and deep waters made it grow tall. Rivers flowed all around where it was planted, sending streams out to every other tree in the field.

verses.kjv: Therefore his height was exalted above all the trees of the field, and his boughs were multiplied, and his branches became long because of the multitude of waters, when he shot forth.
verses.web: Therefore its stature was exalted above all the trees of the field; and its boughs were multiplied. Its branches became long by reason of many waters, when it spread them out.
verses.ct: Because of all that water, it grew taller than every other tree. Its limbs multiplied and its branches stretched out long as it spread wide.

verses.kjv: All the fowls of heaven made their nests in his boughs, and under his branches did all the beasts of the field bring forth their young, and under his shadow dwelt all great nations.
verses.web: All the birds of the sky made their nests in its boughs. Under its branches, all the animals of the field gave birth to their young. All great nations lived under its shadow.
verses.ct: Every bird in the sky nested in its branches. Every wild animal gave birth to its young beneath its limbs. Every great nation lived in its shade.

verses.kjv: Thus was he fair in his greatness, in the length of his branches: for his root was by great waters.
verses.web: Thus it was beautiful in its greatness, in the length of its branches; for its root was by many waters.
verses.ct: It was magnificent in its size and the reach of its branches, because its roots drew from deep, abundant waters.

verses.kjv: The cedars in the garden of God could not hide him: the fir trees were not like his boughs, and the chestnut trees were not like his branches; nor any tree in the garden of God was like unto him in his beauty.
verses.web: The cedars in the garden of God could not hide it. The cypress trees were not like its boughs. The pine trees were not as its branches; nor was any tree in the garden of God like it in its beauty.
verses.ct: No cedar in the garden of God could rival it. No cypress had branches like it, and no plane tree could match its limbs. Not a single tree in the garden of God was as beautiful.

verses.kjv: I have made him fair by the multitude of his branches: so that all the trees of Eden, that were in the garden of God, envied him.
verses.web: I made it beautiful by the multitude of its branches, so that all the trees of Eden, that were in the garden of God, envied it.’
verses.ct: I made it stunning with its countless branches, so that every tree in Eden — right there in the garden of God — was jealous of it.'

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because thou hast lifted up thyself in height, and he hath shot up his top among the thick boughs, and his heart is lifted up in his height;
verses.web: “Therefore thus said the Lord LORD: ‘Because you are exalted in stature, and he has set his top among the thick boughs, and his heart is lifted up in his height;
verses.ct: "So this is what the Lord GOD says: 'Because it grew so tall, pushing its crown up into the thick canopy, its heart swelled with pride over its own height.

verses.kjv: I have therefore delivered him into the hand of the mighty one of the heathen; he shall surely deal with him: I have driven him out for his wickedness.
verses.web: I will even deliver him into the hand of the mighty one of the nations. He will surely deal with him. I have driven him out for his wickedness.
verses.ct: I handed it over to the mightiest ruler among the nations. He dealt with it as it deserved. I drove it out because of its wickedness.

verses.kjv: And strangers, the terrible of the nations, have cut him off, and have left him: upon the mountains and in all the valleys his branches are fallen, and his boughs are broken by all the rivers of the land; and all the people of the earth are gone down from his shadow, and have left him.
verses.web: Strangers, the tyrants of the nations, have cut him off, and have left him. His branches have fallen on the mountains and in all the valleys and his boughs are broken by all the watercourses of the land. All the peoples of the earth have gone down from his shadow, and have left him.
verses.ct: Foreign armies — the most ruthless nations — chopped it down and left it. Its branches fell across the mountains and filled every valley. Its limbs lay broken along every waterway in the land. Every nation on earth stepped out from under its shade and abandoned it.

verses.kjv: Upon his ruin shall all the fowls of the heaven remain, and all the beasts of the field shall be upon his branches:
verses.web: All the birds of the sky will dwell on his ruin, and all the animals of the field will be on his branches;
verses.ct: Now birds roost on its fallen trunk, and wild animals trample through its broken branches.

verses.kjv: To the end that none of all the trees by the waters exalt themselves for their height, neither shoot up their top among the thick boughs, neither their trees stand up in their height, all that drink water: for they are all delivered unto death, to the nether parts of the earth, in the midst of the children of men, with them that go down to the pit.
verses.web: to the end that none of all the trees by the waters exalt themselves in their stature, and don’t set their top among the thick boughs. Their mighty ones don’t stand up on their height, even all who drink water; for they are all delivered to death, to the lower parts of the earth, among the children of men, with those who go down to the pit.’
verses.ct: This happened so that no tree growing by the water would ever again get proud about its height, pushing its crown into the thick canopy, standing tall on its own strength. They are all destined for death — sent down to the depths of the earth, joining ordinary mortals who descend into the pit.'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; In the day when he went down to the grave I caused a mourning: I covered the deep for him, and I restrained the floods thereof, and the great waters were stayed: and I caused Lebanon to mourn for him, and all the trees of the field fainted for him.
verses.web: “The Lord LORD says: ‘In the day when he went down to Sheol I caused a mourning. I covered the deep for him, and I restrained its rivers. The great waters were stopped. I caused Lebanon to mourn for him, and all the trees of the field fainted for him.
verses.ct: "The Lord GOD says: 'On the day it went down to the grave, I made the world mourn. I shut off the underground springs and held back the rivers; the mighty waters stopped flowing. I draped Lebanon in darkness because of it, and every tree in the field withered with grief.

verses.kjv: I made the nations to shake at the sound of his fall, when I cast him down to hell with them that descend into the pit: and all the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, shall be comforted in the nether parts of the earth.
verses.web: I made the nations to shake at the sound of his fall, when I cast him down to Sheol with those who descend into the pit. All the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, were comforted in the lower parts of the earth.
verses.ct: I made nations tremble at the sound of its fall when I threw it down to Sheol alongside everyone else who descends into the pit. Then all the trees of Eden — the finest and best of Lebanon, every tree that drank deep water — found some comfort down in the depths of the earth.

verses.kjv: They also went down into hell with him unto them that be slain with the sword; and they that were his arm, that dwelt under his shadow in the midst of the heathen.
verses.web: They also went down into Sheol with him to those who are slain by the sword; yes, those who were his arm, who lived under his shadow in the middle of the nations.
verses.ct: They too had gone down to Sheol with it, joining those killed by the sword — all the allies who had been its strength, the nations that had lived under its shadow.

verses.kjv: To whom art thou thus like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? yet shalt thou be brought down with the trees of Eden unto the nether parts of the earth: thou shalt lie in the midst of the uncircumcised with them that be slain by the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his multitude, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: “ ‘To whom are you thus like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? Yet you will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the lower parts of the earth. You will lie in the middle of the uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword. “ ‘This is Pharaoh and all his multitude,’ says the Lord LORD.”
verses.ct: "'So tell me, Pharaoh — which of Eden's trees matched your glory and greatness? Yet you will be dragged down with the trees of Eden to the depths of the earth. You will lie among the uncircumcised, alongside those killed by the sword. This is the fate of Pharaoh and all his people,' declares the Lord GOD."
